dsa_helpers.dash package

Submodules

dsa_helpers.dash.dash_paperdragon_utils module

dsa_helpers.dash.dash_paperdragon_utils.format_ann_docs_for_paperjs(geojson_ann_docs: list[dict], return_as_input_to_paper: bool = False) → list[dict][source]

Format DSA annotations in the geojson format into a format that paperdragon can read and show as polygons.

Parameters:

  • geojson_ann_docs (list[dict]) – A list of geojson annotation documents.

  • return_as_input_to_paper (bool) – Whether to return the formatted documents as input to paper. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A list of formatted annotation documents for paperjs. Note that

it will return an empty list if the documents could not be formatted.

Return type:

list[dict]

dsa_helpers.dash.dash_paperdragon_utils.get_input_to_paper_dict(formatted_docs: list[dict] | None = None) → dict[source]

Get the input to paper dictionary.

Parameters:

formatted_docs (list[dict]) – A list of formatted annotation documents for paperjs.

Returns:

The input to paper dictionary.

Return type:

dict

dsa_helpers.dash.header module

dsa_helpers.dash.header.get_header(dsa_api_url: str, title: str = 'App', store_id: str = 'user-store', config: dict | None = None) → Div[source]

Get the Dash html component that contains the header of the application with login capabilities.

Parameters:

  • dsa_api_url (str) – The URL of the DSA API.

  • title (str, optional) – The title of the application. Defaults to “App”.

  • config (dict, optional) –

    The configuration of the component. Defaults to None. If None the default configuration is: {

    ”backgroundColor”: “#012169”, “titleColor”: “#d9d9d6”, “fontColor”: “#f2a900”,

    }

Returns:

The header component.

Return type:

html.Div

dsa_helpers.dash.header_callbacks module

dsa_helpers.dash.header_callbacks.get_callbacks(dsa_api_url: str, store_id: str)[source]

Setup the callbacks to the DSA API url of interest and the proper store id.
